bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 10 (Thursday, January 17, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. COX of California:H.R. 657.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1 Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution.[Page H720]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

item.fullName: Rep. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

item.text:
Immediate Financial Relief for Federal Employees Act

This bill directs the Department of the Treasury to provide interest-free loans to federal and District of Columbia government employees affected by a government shutdown and to notify the individual's employer.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Immediate Financial Relief for Federal Employees Act

item.title: To provide loans to employees of the Federal Government and the government of the District of Columbia affected by a Government shutdown, and for other purposes.
Immediate Financial Relief for Federal Employees Act
Immediate Financial Relief for Federal Employees Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
